skill.name: improving-components
skill.description: Expert at automatically applying improvements to Claude Code components based on quality analysis. Enhances descriptions, optimizes tool permissions, strengthens security, and improves usability. Works in conjunction with analyzing-component-quality skill.
skill.summary: Expert at automatically applying improvements to Claude Code components based on quality analysis. E...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill focused on documentation improvement. Only has Read and Edit tool permissions for modifying component metadata. No executable scripts, network access, or external command execution capabilities. Promotes security hardening as a core principle.

content.value_statement: Claude Code components often have vague descriptions, excessive permissions, or missing documentation. This skill systematically enhances components by improving descriptions, optimizing tool permissions for security, and adding clear usage examples. Components become more effective, secure, and easier to use.
actual_capabilities: Enhance component descriptions with specific auto-invoke triggers
Optimize tool permissions following security best practices
Add usage examples and capability documentation
Apply systematic quality improvements based on analysis
Preserve backward compatibility while improving quality
limitations: Only improves Claude Code component files (agents, skills, commands, hooks)
Cannot create new components from scratch
Cannot modify code logic or functionality
Requires quality analysis input to guide improvements

use_cases.title: Prepare components for marketplace
use_cases.description: Improve newly created components before publishing to ensure descriptions are clear, permissions are minimal, and documentation is complete.

use_cases.title: Systematic quality improvement
use_cases.description: Apply consistent improvements across multiple components based on quality analysis scores and best practice guidelines.

use_cases.title: Reduce permission exposure
use_cases.description: Audit and optimize tool permissions across plugins to follow the principle of least privilege and improve security posture.

prompt_templates.title: Quick component improvement
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the improving-components skill to enhance this component. Focus on making the description specific with clear auto-invoke triggers and optimizing tool permissions.

prompt_templates.title: Security hardening
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the improving-components skill to this component with focus on security. Remove unnecessary tools and document why each remaining tool is needed.

prompt_templates.title: Description enhancement
prompt_templates.prompt: Use improving-components to rewrite this description. Make it specific about what the component does, when it activates, and what outputs it provides.

prompt_templates.title: Full component audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the improving-components skill on this entire plugin. Apply critical security fixes first, then important improvements like description clarity and documentation, and finally nice-to-have enhancements.

output_examples.input: Improve this skill: description: 'Helps with testing', allowed-tools: Read, Write, Edit, Bash, Task
output: Description enhanced: 'Expert at writing unit tests for JavaScript/TypeScript functions. Auto-invokes when user asks to test code or completes writing a new function.'
Tools optimized: Read, Edit (removed Write, Bash, Task - testing skill does not need write access or command execution)
Security improved: Minimal permission set follows principle of least privilege

best_practices: Apply critical security improvements first before cosmetic changes
Preserve existing functionality by only modifying metadata and documentation
Document the reasoning behind each tool permission for future audits
anti_patterns: Adding excessive tool permissions for hypothetical future use
Making changes without reviewing the impact on existing users
Improving descriptions without adding specific auto-invoke triggers

faq.question: Does this skill modify my actual code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only modifies Claude Code component metadata like descriptions, tool permissions, and documentation. It never changes functional code logic.

faq.question: Can I preview changes before applying them?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill follows an incremental approach where each improvement is presented before application. You can review and approve changes step by step.

faq.question: How does this work with the analyzing-component-quality skill?
faq.answer: The analyzing skill provides quality analysis and identifies issues. The improving skill takes those findings and applies specific enhancements to resolve them.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use on production components?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill preserves backward compatibility and focuses on metadata improvements that do not change component behavior.

faq.question: What permissions does this skill need?
faq.answer: This skill requires only Read and Edit permissions to access and modify component files. No network, Bash, or delegation capabilities.

faq.question: How is this different from agent-builder enhance command?
faq.answer: The improving-components skill is auto-invoked for quality improvements. The agent-builder enhance command is user-triggered. Both work together seamlessly.
